title: 108_hr4915
content: The "Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2004" is cited as the short title. It introduces an exclusion for gain from stock of small, publicly traded companies in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The "Small Investment Tax Relief Act of 2004" excludes gain from the sale or exchange of section 1203 stock held for over 1 year for non-corporate taxpayers. The exclusion is limited to $100,000 ($50,000 for married individuals filing separately) per taxable year. 1203 stock refers to stock in a C corporation acquired after the enactment date if the corporation is a qualified small business at the time of acquisition. The term '1203 stock' refers to stock in a C corporation acquired after the enactment date if the corporation is a qualified small business at the time of acquisition. The term '1203 stock' refers to stock in a C corporation acquired after the enactment date if the corporation is a qualified small business at the time of acquisition. Such stock is acquired in exchange for money, other property, or as compensation for services provided to the corporation. It must be publicly traded on a recognized stock exchange or market at the time of sale or exchange. The term '1203 stock' refers to stock in a C corporation acquired after the enactment date if the corporation is a qualified small business at the time of acquisition. It must be publicly traded on a recognized stock exchange or market at the time of sale or exchange. The term 'qualified small business' refers to a domestic C corporation with a market capitalization not exceeding $150,000,000 at the time of stock acquisition. Market capitalization is determined on the date of stock acquisition. The market capitalization of a qualified small business, or any predecessor, must not exceed $150,000,000 at the time of stock acquisition. Market capitalization is calculated based on the closing price of a share of stock in the corporation at the end of the reporting period before the acquisition date. The amount for stock acquisition is based on the closing price of a share of stock multiplied by the number of outstanding shares, or determined by all relevant facts if the first method does not apply. The amount for stock acquisition is determined based on the closing price of a share of stock multiplied by the number of outstanding shares, or by considering all relevant facts if the first method is not applicable. The amount for stock acquisition is determined based on the most recent amounts paid for each class of stock in the corporation outstanding on the date of the acquisition of the 1203 stock, considering all relevant facts and circumstances. The reporting period refers to the period for which the most recent annual or quarterly report is required to be filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission. The term 'reporting period' refers to the period for which the most recent annual or quarterly report is required to be filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. Aggregation rules similar to section 1202(d)(3) apply for paragraph (1), and additional rules are in place for subsections (f), (g), (h), (i), and (j). Aggregation rules similar to section 1202(d)(3) apply for paragraph (1), and additional rules are in place for subsections (f), (g), (h), (i), and (j) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934. Conforming amendments are made to section 642(c)(4) of the Code by inserting references to sections 1203(a) and 1203. Conforming amendments are made to various sections of the Code by inserting references to sections 1203(a) and 1203. Conforming amendments are made to various sections of the Code by inserting references to sections 1203(a) and 1203, including amendments to sections 643(a)(3), 691(c)(4), 871(a)(2), and 1044(d). Section 1202(b) is also amended by adding a new subsection. Section 871(a)(2) of the Code is amended to include references to sections 1202 and 1203. Section 1044(d) is also amended to include reference to section 1203. Additionally, a new subsection is added to section 1202(b) regarding section 1203 stock. The new subsection states that sales and exchanges under section 1203 will not be considered under this section. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections, inserting a new item after section 1202. The new subsection excludes gains from stock of small, publicly traded companies. Effective date applies to securities acquired after enactment of the Act.
